references.paper_title: Nerf: Representing scenes as neural radiance fields for view synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduced the foundational Neural Radiance Field (NeRF) model, which revolutionized novel view synthesis and serves as a cornerstone for many subsequent advancements in the field, including the work presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: Nerf in the dark: High dynamic range view synthesis from noisy raw images
references.reason: This paper extended the NeRF model to utilize raw images, directly addressing the limitations of traditional RGB images in representing HDR scenes, a critical aspect of the work in this paper.

references.paper_title: 3D Gaussian splatting for real-time radiance field rendering
references.reason: This paper introduced 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS), a method employed in this paper as the primary model for novel view synthesis, offering significant improvements in rendering speed and making real-time applications possible.

references.paper_title: Image denoising by sparse 3-d transform-domain collaborative filtering
references.reason: This paper introduced a significant advancement in image denoising techniques, which are crucial for processing noisy raw images as done in this paper's approach.

references.paper_title: Learnability enhancement for low-light raw denoising: Where paired real data meets noise modeling
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenges of denoising in low-light conditions, which are relevant to this paper, by proposing a novel method that leverages both data-driven techniques and noise modeling, a critical aspect of handling the noisy raw images in the current paper.
